head.title: simple off-line blog utility

section.p: The sblg utility, sblg(1), accepts a bunch of blag entries and performs the following:

ul.li: merges individual entries with a template
merges entries together into some sort of front page
is simple (no Ruby, no template languages, no crap)

section.p: Want simplified HTML markup, in-line LaTeX editing, smartphone auto-templating, or modules? Neither do we. sblg is simple and for people who can already write proper HTML and CSS, version their sources into CVS, configure a Makefile, and install into some sort of static htdocs directory.

sblg links against libexpat, which is bundled on most UNIX operating systems, and is otherwise ISO C under the open-source ISC license. If you're interested, download the sblg.tar.gz sources (version @VERSION@, dated @VDATE@), make install into the PREFIX of your choice, and enjoy!
